1.content:
Let me first tell you about what is going on. There are Immortal creatures, like dragons, gnomes, orgers, fairies, undines, stuff like that. These creatures do not die unless killed, so they can't die of old age and sickness. This story is set in a Medieval-ish time, so people can worship different Gods, and they could be real. What I mean by Liona having a 'gift' with immortals is that they are...nicer to her, they listen to her, and sometimes talk back, mind to mind.
QuickSilver is Liona's pet baby dragon, she is to young to speak mind to mind. Dragons are very magical creatures so QuickSilver is constantly experimenting with her developing magic. Queen Delia hates dragons and thinks that they are horrible bloodthristy beasts. Liona thinks the exact opposite. King Jefory is a very kind king and some times a little weird, but his heart is always in the right place.
Well I think that's it.
1.title: First of all

11.content:
Let me give you some back round information on Liona and Gwen.

Princess Gwen Princess Gwen is sixteen years old. She has dirty blonde hair and blue-gray eyes. She doesn't like her step mother and her two step sisters, but tries to get along. She is the classic rebel princess, sort of. She doesn't like all to sow and doesn't like to take the etiquette classes, but she does anyway. The mystery of her long lost sister, who she can't really remember now, is always in the back of her mind, even though it's been a few years now. She still has the 'women were dresses' out look and since she's been around her step mother and sisters for so long she sort of shares their views on dragons and other immortals, though she has never really been around them to know for sure what they are like.

Liona Liona is fourteen years old, and light redish-brown hair, and has blue-green eyes, like the ocean. She loves QuickSilver with all her heart. QuickSilver comes to Liona's waist. She will not wear a dress, she wears a shirt and breeches, no more no less. Liona lives alone with QhickSilver. She makes camp for a few weeks then moves on. She gets captured by slave traders and sold to Princess Gwen. Liona is very set in her belifes. Roylity acts this way, nobility acts this way, and commoners and servents act this way. Liona believes in the shut up and deal with it way of life. She is very smart. This is one of her many mottoes: Never mess with someone who has the power to kill you, say what they want to hear. Liona looks on the bright sides of things. Example: Someone tells Liona that if she does a certian thing she'll die, Liona would say something like 'Look at it this way, if I die you'll have one less person to look after.'
11.title: Who you gonna be?

111.content:
What am I going to do today? you think as you comb your hair. You could go for a walk in the gardens, that's always nice. You could spend some time with your step sisters. You continue to think as you go down to breakfast.

"Gwen. I've been thinking," you father says at breakfast, "It's time that you knew how to buy servents."
"Jefory, why should she? You know we can always get another servent to do it." Delia says, you never call her 'mother' unless you have to.
"I know but it's a good skill to learn. It shows the villagers that we take interest in the things they do."
"It's alright...mother, I'd like to know what to look for in a servent." If anyone noticed the pause before you said mother they don't show it.
"That's my girl! A little bit after breakfast then?" father asks. You nod. You're not sure if you did that because you actually do want to go with your father or if you just wanted to get out of this stuffy old castle.

1111.content:
As you walk through the city with your father he tells you what to look for in a servent.
"They should be strong. Look for scars if they have a lot don't buy them, it means they don't listen. If the slave is jumpy their better for work inside the castle." You try to remember it all.

Finally you come to the slave traders stand. Everyone makes way for you and father. It begins and a man in silk and velvet walks out with a rope in his hand.
"This is Kane," he pulls on the rope and the man on the other end comes out he is very tell and broad-shouldered. He's wearing a loincloth, "He put up quite a fight, very strong. A little stubborn but nothing a whip can't handle." People start to bid, you don't like it but you'll have to do it eventually, might as well get used to it. More slaves come out and are bought. Finally the slave master announces that he will bring out one more. He pulls on a rope and a girl comes out. She, like the rest, isn't wearing much. She has light reddish-brown hair that stops just above her waist. Her face is set so you can't tell what she's thinking. With her is a...dragon? Why is a dragon with this girl? The dragon has it's legs tied together, so that this girl has to carry it, and a muzzle on. It's scales are scarlet and very small bits of lighting play across it's skin.
"This is Liona. The dragon comes with her."
"Her name it QuickSilver," the girl says, her voice barly more then a whisper. The slave master hits her hard enogh to force her to her knees.
"As you can see Liona is a bit of a troublemaker, but a good whiping can fix that. The dragon is rather vicious, a perfact fighting dragon. Liona is a hard worker, when given a reason. Do I hear a bid?" A few people bid back and forth. There is something about her that feels familar, like you met her somewhere.

Should you buy her?

"I was wondering. Dragons are very magical and have their own language like everything else, right? If they are so smart why can't they talk to us?" Liona puts her oil bottle down and looks at you thoughtfully.

1111112.content:
NOTE TO READERS: I'm going to switch the POV to a more standard 3rd person omniscient. Sorry if this is jarring.

Liona looked around the interior of the royal carriage with some effort made to conceal her amazement. Jefory saw this and give a wink, "I'd wager you've never been inside a carriage so big, have you, Liona?"

All emotion washed from the girl's face as quickly as it had appeared. She crossed her arms at her chest and scowled, "I've never been in entire VILLAGES this big... Your Majesty."

Gwen was shocked at this slave girl's flippancy toward the King, but Jefory slapped his knee and let slip a hearty laugh, Whoah-HO! I see your wit is as sharp as your dragon's teeth! What a fine selection you have made, Gwen!"

Again Liona's face leaned toward the stern; she furrowed a scathing eyebrow at the princess and grumbled, "Agreed, milady. You certainly excel at purchasing slaves -- a real knack. I shall strive to do my best at your every beck and call."

Jefory leaned forward and waggled a finger at the young girl, "You are not a slave, Liona, you are a servant. There have been no slaves in my kingdom in many a year -- in your entire lifetime, I'd suppose. How old are you, girl, by the way?"

Liona softened a touch, but was unused to opening up about herself. She said simply, "Fourteen."

Jefory's eyes faded away for a moment as he let out a soft, sad sigh.

Liona's scowl deepened, "Surely you have slaves. A kingdom of this size..."

"A kingdom of this size," Jefory interrupted, "believes that everyone should be free. No man shall face the whip like a lowly beast of burden in my rule."

Liona reached for the door as the carriage jostled along the road, "Well in that case, I'll be taking my leave of you. Good day, Your Highness."

"Don't you want to know why we purchased you in the first place?"

"No. I thought I was free."

Jefory chuckled, "Free to hear me out."

He pointed to the seat across from him, next to Gwen, "Please, sit. Listen to my offer."
1111112.title: You can't remember

choices: "Coachman!  Stop Here!  We Must Capture That Girl!"
11111122.content:
Liona looked from the old man's royal face to her hand, still firmly clamped to the door handle. She then looked to Quicksilver, who stared unconcerned out the window at the passing trees. The king's offer seemed genuine, and Liona's interest was indeed piqued, but life on the road had taught her to distrust all acts of kindness, and she had precious few seconds to consider her actions. Her mind was fast, however, and decisive. She smiled at King Jefory Rogersmith III, gave his daughter a wink, and curtsied resplendently, "Thank you for your generosity Your Highness, but I believe my dragon and I will take our freedom elsewhere."

Liona unlatched the handle and swung out as the door opened wide.

Gwen squealed, "Father!" but Jefory sat back and did nothing, apparently amused with Liona's daring escape.

Just before Liona let go of the door handle and tumbled into the roadside bramble, she turned to look at the king, "I promise to return your three pieces of gold!"

Jefory smiled, "Of that I have no doubt! Don't forget your dragon!"

But Quicksilver was already bustling past him and out the door, where he spread his wings and easily took flight. Meanwhile Liona's poor body hit the ground and bounced around in the reeds.
11111122.title: She Bolts

111111222.content:
Liona skidded to a halt as the royal carriage continued on its way back to the castle. Her head was swirling, and every bit of exposed skin stung from its mistreatment from the brush, but she pushed herself to her knees. Her arms wobbled, and she thought for a moment that she might vomit, but both her shoulders and her stomach held. Eventually, she raised her head and sat back on her heels. She held her hands to her head in an effort to keep her brains from spilling from her ears, and soon the world stopped spinning and she was better able to evaluate her injuries.

Nothing broken, that was a good sign. And aside from a multitude of tiny cuts and scrapes, most of which would heal in a couple days, she was fine. She exhaled deeply and smiled, happy with the end result of remaining alive after leaping from a moving carriage. She would freely admit that it was one of her more foolhardy gambits, especially considering the alternative was, what? Spending her days working closely with the king? Safely behind the impenetrable walls of the castle? Abundant food for which she needn't beg nor steal? Upon further consideration it was most likely a cushy deal.

But still... she was no man's slave.

Even a king.

She picked a twig from her wild hair and nodded; she had made the right choice.

Quicksilver flapped over and plucked another twig from her hair.

"I know, I know," she grumbled, "I probably made the wrong choice, didn't I?"
111111222.title: Liona Bounces, Then Runs Away

1111112221.content:
Princess Gwen remained silent for the rest of the return trip to the castle, allowing her father to ramble on without actually hearing his words. Her thoughts revolved around that peculiar girl, Liona. Why had Gwen selected her, of all people? Certainly there were others with higher value than that vagabond/thief that Gwen could (and probably should) have chosen, yet the princess' attention had been unerringly drawn to the sullen Liona. So strong was her feeling that she had purchased the girl without actually thinking it through. On the one hand she was pleased that her father approved of her selection, but on the other she was embarrassed to seen with that repulsive girl. Upon their arrival back home, Gwen bade her father good afternoon and made her way to her room so she could ponder her morning's adventure. Her servants and midwives scurried nervously to and fro but she sent them away so she could be alone with her thoughts.

She lay down on her bed and laced her fingers behind her hair as she stared out the window to watch the gusts of wind ruffle the branches of nearby trees.

It annoyed her that Father was less annoyed than she. Maybe she was more fiscally responsible than The King, because he seemed unconcerned about the coin used to purchase a slave girl that could have been better spent as garnish at a horse trough. Gwen pursed her lips and thought, "Just because we have the money to waste doesn't mean it is advisable to do so!"

She sighed and tried to convince herself that it was not important enough to get herself so worked up. She would be better off simply forgetting about the whole ordeal. Given time, she was sure she could become shrewd in the art of negotiations. Today, although a complete failure in Gwen's mind, could still serve as a valuable lesson that she dare not forget.

Just let the girl go, whatever her name was.

Liona. And her intense eyes stared back at Gwen's memory with enough heat as if she sat next to Gwen on the bed.

Gwen shivered at the thought of that wayward waif entering Gwen's Royal Bedchambers -- no doubt under the cloak of darkness with the intent to steal as much as she could carry. Her gown suddenly grew very heavy and itchy around her shoulders. How she loathed how Father made her dress up just to go into town! Every one of those regal -- and expensive -- gowns that hung from her closet were about as comfortable as a fortnight spent getting drawn and quartered, and the corset she currently wore beneath her tresses proved unbearable.

"Corrina!" she bellowed.

The door immediately opened and a tall, thin woman appeared.

"Corrina, kindly undress me and remove this cursed corset. I wish to wear something more comfortable."

"As you wish, ma'am. What shall I do with the corset, milady?"

"Burn it."

"Of course, ma'am."

Princess Gwen's dress was held together with about two hundred yards of ribbon, judging by the amount of tugging and pulling on Corrina's part.

"Almost?"

"Very nearly there, milady."

"So is lunch. I'll have eaten by the time you free me from these bounds, woman!"

"Yes, milady."

"Hurry!"

At once the pressure was released and her lungs were free to take in oxygen unhindered once more. The dress fell to the floor and Gwen stepped out of it. She held up her arms and turned so that Corrina could next work on the corset. That was a chore as well, one which strained Gwen's patience, but once Corrina pried it from Gwen's torso Gwen sighed and slipped into a rather plain-looking dress that was one of the princess' favorites.

She sat again on her bed and instructed Corrina to leave her alone until lunch; she had much to think about.

choices: Go see if Liona is alright
1112121221.content:
Durning your freetime you wander aronf the palace groungs, deep in thought. You stp to look at your surroundings and see the dragon stables off to your right and the dragon pasture in front of you.

As you walk closer you see two dragons are about to get into a fight, their scales are the deep scarlet of dragon rage and lighting plays over their scales in strands and sheets. Most of the hostlers run to stop the fight before it begins, Liona is one of them. One of the dragons swings his tail around. All the hostlers duck. Liona doesn't duck in time and is sent, head over heels, into one or the large marble pillars set around the pasture. She slids down slowly and stops in a pile at the bottom. None of the hostlers go to help her, they are to busy getting the dragons under control.
1112121221.title: Dragon fight

choices: You meet the people who made the noise
112.content:
"QuickSilver? QuickSilver where'd you go?" you call, "I brought midday." You hear a shrill whistle behind a few trees. You go over to her and see a few stones in front of her.
"What are you doing?" QuickSilver arranges the stones into a star and trills. The stones glow and spark.
"Wow. Can you make it any brighter?" QuickSilver shakes her head.
"Oh well, come on let's eat." QuickSilver jumps up and draps herself around your shoulders as you walk back to camp.
"You know you're getting to big to sit there," you mutter. You put her down next to your bow and quiver of arrows.
"What do you want? A lizard or some bird I shot?" QuickSilver gives an inquiring whistle, you know what she's asking.
"No I don't know what kind of bird it is, what do you want?" QuickSilver snatches the lizard out of your hand, and nearly takes your hand with it.
"You know you could just tell me," you grumble and start a fire, to cook your bird.

While you cook your bird and QuickSilver licks her claws you hear a sound. It sounds like humans.
"QuickSilver we might have company get ready." You reach for your bow and arrows.
"I'll go check it out, you stay here." You set out toward the sound, arrow ready to fire.

What do you find?
112.title: The sound

choices: While the other slaves are being sold
1121.content:
As you get closer to a clearing you hear voices. Soon you're able to see who the voices belong to. There are about twenty...twentysix men and they are leading other people into a wagon. The people in the wagon have their hands tied and aren't wearing much. Slave traders and their slaves. Just what I need, you think. You feel something bump your ankle.
"QuuckSilver! I told you to wait at camp," you whisper. QuickSilver whistles and trills and chirps in answer.
"Alright, alright. Just be quite." Though you have no idea what she said. While you watch QuickSilvers scale slowly change color to fit her mood.
"Come on let's go back to camp." QuickSilver reluctantly follows

Once you and QuickSilver are at camp she keeps talking to you using the series of whistles, trills, and chirps she always does.
"QuickSilver, if I did try to save them what chance do you think I would have? Even with you, there were about twenty men out there." You know what she wants to do. "You know what QuickSilver? It should be the other way around. I should want to go save the slaves and you should be the smart one." QuickSilver gives you an inquireing chirp.
"Yeah smart. You should know that if even if we snuck in they'd find us and get one new slave, I'm not sure if they'd let me keep you."
"Maybe if you ask real nice," a gruff voice says behind you. You don't have a chance to turn around, you feel the tip of a sword rest on your back. The slave traders are already tieing QuickSilver.

You carry QuickSilver to the wagon.
1121.title: Caught

choices: That you have walked into a trap
That the slave traders have surronded QuickSilver
1122.content:
You walk to the edge of a clearing and see three tents. It's a camp. Looks like I've found supper you think. You sneak into the camp and look inside the tents. Two of them are meant for sleeping and the other one is full of people tied up. They all looked starved. A few of them beg for you to let them go. It's a slave traders camp. Fear bubbles up inside you. You know what slave traders do to the people they catch. You hear a shriek, they found QuickSilver. You to help her, not thinking.

When you get there you find...
1122.title: Slave traders

choices: When they begin to sell the slaves
Right before they begin to sell the slaves
11222.content:
You take no time to think. You loose an arrow an hit one of the men in the back QuickSilver runs past the fallen man to you side. The rest of the slave traders run at you swords at the ready. You let three more arrows fly each hitting their target. A small battle continues for a while but finally they over power you and QuickSilver and tie you up. They lead you to the camp and put you in the slaves tent. QuickSilver they tie to a tree.

All night long QuickSilver shrieks, whistles, and trills making it hard to sleep.

The next morning they put a muzzle on QuickSilver, with much dificulty, and put you and the rest of the slaves into a wagon. You have convinced them to let you bring QuickSilver, but you have to carry her, because they tied her feet and tail.
11222.title: Caught

choices: Does it look like the girl is going to buy you
Does it look like the nobleman is going to buy you
112221.content:
QuickSilver shrieks and trills loudly, tring to get out of her ropes.
"QuickSilver hush. Save it for our new 'home'," you mutter, she stops. You scan the crowd as the biding starts. You see a girl who is staring at you. From the way she is dressed and the way people act around her, she must be nobility, or someone important at any rate. She looks confused and a little awed. You lock eyes for a second, only a second, but there is something familar about those eyes. Like you've seen them before. You brush the thought aside as you are pushed to the front.
"This little girl and the dragon come together," the master trader says.
"This 'little girl and dragon' killed five of your men," you mutter, just loud enough for the people closest to hear. One of the other men hit the back of your knees with a stick and hit you in the back with the tip, hard. You fall to your knees and let QuickSilver go. The bits of lighting that have been dancing across her, now, scralet scales flares. You pick her up and try to calm her down while the biding starts, soon it looks like two people are tring to get you. That girl you locked eyes with and some nobleman.
112221.title: Biding

choices: Are you put to work inside the castle?
Are you put to work outside the castle?
1122211.content:
The girl is winning. You don't know how much money the bidding has gone up to, nor do you care. You've gotten QuickSilver to calm down so the bits lighting aren't there anymore and her scales have turned gone to a lighter shade of scarlet. Finally you are sold to the girl.

The slave master leads you to her.
"If m'lady wishes, may I untie QuickSilver?" you ask.
"Yes," she says.

On the ride to your new 'home' you find out that you are the slave of the Princess. You think the entire way. Once there you decide that you're going to make them not want you.
"QuickSilver I want you to not listen to anyone, be mean when they want you to be nice and nice when they want you to be mean. You know the worst dragon." She chirps her understanding.
1122211.title: Outside or Inside

11222112.content:
Once at the palace the king tells you, "You will work at the dragon stables," He points to gigantic stables made out of stone, "Rashad, the chief hostler, will tell you what to do." You bow to him and walk toward the stables, QuickSilver at your heels.

"Who are you?" A male voice says, the voice is mid-range and tring to sound gruff, but failing.
"Liona, the new hostler." A man walks out, do you know him?
11222112.title: The stables

choices: Rashad tells you the do's and don't's of being a hostler
112221121.content:
A man, about twenty walks out. He has a mass of brown hair that is pulled into a horsetail, and the most imposible green eyes. He is wearing a sleevless shirt and breeches, both brown, over a well muscled body.
QuickSilver gives a shrill trill and runs up to Rashad, there she scolds him.
"And who is this?" He's not tring to sound mean anymore. He picks up QuickSilver and looks her over, eyes dancing.
"QuickSilver? That would mean..." He looks at you. You finally get a good look at him and you know who he is.
"Liona!" Before you know what happened Rashad is hugging you so hard you think you might pop, you're hugging him equally as hard. You and Rashad used to travel together, until slave traders caught him. It's like seeing your brother again, though he isn't your brother, you don't have any siblings. He lets you go and hugs QuickSilver, ignoring her protests.
"You were very sad when they took me away?" Rashad asks, when he has stoped hugging you and QuickSilver.
"A little, but I got over it, why? Fishing for compliments?"
"Well from the sounds of it QuickSilver is very angry at me for leaving and 'taking my dear sweet time coming back'. And worring you so. Apperently I owe both of you an apology. Well, Liona, QuickSilver, I am sorry to have worried you so." He says mockingly. You punch him.
"What are the odds huh? A reunion in chains." You pick up QuickSilver and follow Rashad as he looks for a stable to put her in.
"It's not that bad, Liona. They don't keep us in chains and we're well fed. Just stay away from the royal family, they'll do nothing but trouble." All the stables are made of stone and there is a hammock over each one. Some hostlers are sleeping in the hammocks, the dragons are all outside.
"Here, you should like this one, it has a good view of the pasture." Rashad opens the door to a stable, you put QuickSilver inside. When Rashad closes the door QuickSilver claws at the door.
"It's okay QuickSilver you'll be fine," To Rashad you say, "Can you give her some rocks or pebbles to play with? She does this really funny trick with them." Rashad nods.
112221121.title: Meeting an old friend

1122211212.content:
"Rashad is okay if I wander around for a while?" You look at him hopefully.
"Sure, wait come here I wanna show you somethin'." He leads you to the front of the stables. Walking on the road are four women.
"That's Queen Delia, the one in the crimsion and wearing a crown, stay away from her at all costs, even if it makes you late. The one beside her, in the peach dress, that's Princess Yolan. Beside her, in the blue, she's Princess Ruth. Stay away from them too, don't let any of them see you. Now the one in green at the end, that's Princess Gwen, you can let her see you, she's pretty nice." Rashad points to all of then in turn.
"I know, Princess Gwen bought me." Rashad winces, "Once Yolan and Ruth hear that, they'll tell you that you are Gwen's personal servent and you're not to leave her side," Rashad says, "Hey, if your going to wander, go to the gardens and climb the vines to the roof. You'll want to find a good seat for tonight." With that Rashad walks away.
"What are you talking about?" you call. Rashad ignores you.
1122211212.title: Wandering

11222112121.content:
You decide you see what Rashad means.
You walk to the gardens. It takes you a while to find the vines. When you climb them you see that the walls block you from veiw.

When you are on the roof you catch your breath. There are flat surfaces that you can walk on, the tiles allow you to walk up the parts of roof that are raised. In places where it is to steep to just walk there are foot and hand holds carved into it. You explore the roof in amazement. There are a few people on the roof with you.
"Who eles knows about this?" you ask someone.
"Only the hostlers and a few palace servents." he says with a grin. You finally come to the top of a rise. At the top it widens and is flat, it's just wide enough to fit two people. When you look around your breath catches in your throat for the second time. It over looks the pasture and Royal Forest. In the pasture some dragons are flying and the others are just lounging on the ground. You see someone has let QuickSilver out, you think that's QuickSilver anyway. Different colored scales flash in the sun, sometimes the dragons in the air will blow fire, though it only lasts a second.
"This is beautiful," you breath.
"You should see it at night," a voice whispers in your ear. You turn around, it's Rashad.
"Royalty don't know about this?" you whisper, you're afraid that if you talk any louder then that the dragons will stop and go inside.
"Nop." You don't even notice when Rashad leaves
11222112121.title: The roof

112221121212.content:
You finally tear your eyes away and go back to the ground.
The pasture is to big to even guess at the size. To keep the dragons in there are gigantic pillars that stand twenty feet apart, the dragons are trained to not go past them. For the ones who don't listen they wear collars that gives them a nasty little shock when they go past the pilars.

You walk to the pasture to see QuickSilver. Once there you see that Rashad has given her a lage pile of stones and pebbles to play with. QuickSilver looks at you and whistles, she wants to show you something. She picks out a few pebbles and puts then in front of her. The noise she makes sounds like a cross between a croak, a whistle, and a chirp. All the stones glow and spark. The three in the middle actually hiss faintly.
"Wow! QuickSilver that was great! I wish I could do that." You crouch beside her and scratch behind her ears.
"How did it do that?" someone asks behind you.
112221121212.title: QuickSilver's trick

choices: Do some work around the stables
Go back to the roof of the palace
1122211212122.content:
You turn around, it's Princess Gwen. She's looking at QuickSilver with interest, something about her looks familiar but you can't quite remember.
"Her name is QuickSilver, miss. Dragons are very magical. QuickSilver, here, is just getting a feel for her powers. She'll be able to do much more then these 'lil tricks when she gets to be their size." You point to the adult dragons. Gwen's look of interest increases.
"How old is it...what did you say her name was?"
"QuickSilver, miss. Oh she's about...umm..." You mutter to yourself, trying to remember how old QuickSilver is, "Let's see I got her when I was...uh...four? No five. Back then she was...seven? No ten, yeah ten months old...miss, I'm sorry I don't know how old QuickSilver is, and it would take to long to figure it out...miss?" Princess Gwen has a far away look. Like she is remembering something.
"Wha-? Oh yes it's alright..."
"Liona." You give her your name when you realize she doesn't know it.
"It's alright Liona. I must be going." Princess Gwen walks away.
"Humph. How d'you like that QuickSilver? She's the one that bought me and she can't remember my name."
1122211212122.title: Princess Gwen

11222112121221.content:
You do some work around the stables, small task that don't need to be done, you just need something to do.

When the other hostlers broght the dragons in Inferno, a giant, bad tempered fire dragon, got away from Rashad and it took most of the hostlers and you, and many hours, to get him in his stable. When you climb into the hammock above QuickSilver's stable.
Rashad wakes you soon after you close your eyes, "Follow me, remember the roof?"
11222112121221.title: Inferno

choices: Ask him what he's looking at
112221121212211.content:
Eager to see what it looks like at night you follow Rashad to the garden.

Once on the roof you and Rashad go to the spot you were before. You can see the black outlines of the dragons few dragons that are let out durning the night to hunt. They torch their prey and fly down to catch it, it's beautiful.
"I'd bet Queen Delia would change her mind about dragons once she came up here," you mutter.
"No chance in heaven or hell you're bringing anyone up here. Let anlone royalty. This is here to remind us dragon hostlers why we risk our necks everyday for those beasts," Rachad says, not harshly.
"But some palace servents know," you argue.
"Retired hostlers." Something light flies at the edge of your vision, you turn. It's just a firefly, a big firefly.
"Pretty, pretty big fling things," a small squeaky voice says beside you. You turn with a start. That big firefly - or whatever it is - was perching on your shoulder.
"Rashad," you whisper, and point it out. He frowns and catches it. From his fist you her the squeaking voice yelling shrilly. Rashad opens his fist and quickly puts his eye over the opening.
"It's either a pixi or a fairy.Funny I thought they stayed away from humans." He lets it go and it flies back to you yelling "Pixi! I be a pixi!"
"It - she, sorry - says she's a pixi, Rashad," you say. You can't see the look he gives you, but he looks at you a long time. You don't like it.
112221121212211.title: The pixi

choices: Explain, to the best of your ability, what you were doing
Don't explain, and hope Rashad doesn't think you're insane
1122211212122112.content:
You choose to ignore Rashad.
"Thoses dragons are pretty," you mutter.
"Pretty, pretty flying things," the pixi repeats, "They are called dragons." You try to ignore the look Rashad is giving you.
"There are a lot more dragons over there." You point to the stables, "They're stone so that the dragons won't torch it." The pixi giggles, "I go see...dragons. Sleeping dragons?"
"Yep, the dragons in there are asleep." The pixi flies off toward the stables. Only now do you realize that Rashad was listening and that he could only hear one side of the conversation.
1122211212122112.title: Conversations

choices: Stay and ask Rashad about the wizards
11222112121221121.content:
You look at Rashad, "I could understand it...the pixi. It was interested in the dragons. You don't think I'm crazy do you?"

Rashad looks seriouse, "Anymore than usual, no. I know a few wizards who have that power."
11222112121221121.title: Power?

112221121212211211.content:
"Well, as beautiful as this is, I'm afraid I'm going to have to go to sleep," you say, carefully standing up and giving Rashad a brotherly kiss on the cheek.

You climb down the roof and into your hammock almost immeadiately falling asleep. You never realised how tired you were.
112221121212211211.title: Sleepy time.

info.brief_description: A princess, a long lost sister, a new servent, and an evil step mother, you do the math
info.description: King Jefory has bought his daughter, Gwen, a new servent almost like a sweet sixteen preasent. Liona, the new servent, has a strange gift with immortal creatures, dragons, orgers, fairies, and the like. So eventualy she is put to work in the dragon stables. Gwens step mother, Queen Delia, doesn't like Liona for some reason. Maybe it's because Liona has a baby dragon as a pet, or because Liona is the same age as Gwens long lost sister would be now and she almost looks like her, but no knows for sure because they don't quite remember what she looked like please please PLEASE GIVE ME YOUR IMPUT AND ADD CHAPTERS!!
